column1: Raisio (Finnish pronunciation: [ˈrɑisio]; Swedish: Reso) is a town and municipality in south-western Finland and an important junction of major roads. The town has a population of 24
column2: 344 (31 July 2020) and is located in the region of Southwest Finland
column4: Turku. The town's land area is 48.76 km2 (18.83 sq mi)
column5: and has about 5 kilometres (3 mi) of coastline to the Bay of Raisio on its southern tip.

column1: The oldest known written records relating to Raisio are from the year 1292
column2: and there is strong evidence of Stone Age settlement in the area
column3: but Raisio did not become a city until 1974. Until the late 20th century
column4: this was an agricultural area. The success of the Raisio Group transformed it into an industrial centre
column5: and triggered a huge increase in population – during the 20th century the population of Raisio grew elevenfold. The town's existence was under threat
column6: as Turku was planning on merging Raisio to it. This changed after Raisio Group became a successful company.

column1: The name Raisio was originally given to its river
column2: Raisionjoki. The earliest form of the river's name is Raisajoki
column4: and etymological evidence of this can be seen in the Estonian word raisnik
column5: meaning "peatland meadow". Another theory behind the etymology of the name Raisio is that it comes from the word raiskio
column6: meaning a forest that's been damaged by poor foresting
column7: because the Raisio landscape was changed due to sloughs and post-glacial rebound after the Ice Age.

column1: Results of the 2019 Finnish parliamentary election in Raisio:
The town's location on good traffic connections and near the region's capital has contributed greatly to its growth. Its main industries are services
column2: foodstuffs and chemical manufacturing. The largest employer in the town is the Raisio Group

column1: Raisio is also home to the Mylly shopping centre
column2: one of the largest in Scandinavia.

column1: The town also has the third IKEA of Finland.
The town of Raisio has many cultural venues
column2: such as the Friisilä handicrafts center
column3: which offers the visitor a glimpse at traditional Finnish arts and crafts. The cultural center Harkko in the town center comprises an arts museum
column4: an archaeological museum and a theatre. The city library and swimming center Ulpukka are also worth mentioning. In Raisio is also Finland's biggest

column1: middle school which is called "Vaisaaren yläkoulu".
